main event: A shiny white or aluminum colored object was observed rising rapidly over Altadena, California on 29 October 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1 1/2 minutes by multiple witnesses including law enforcement., Witnesses reported the object moving from Northeast to Southwest and increasing in speed., The object did not emit any sound, tail, or exhaust., It was likely identified as a weather balloon released from Santa Monica Airport., The sighting is documented in a Project Blue Book report.
sighted object: one shiny white or aluminum colored object
witness description: Includes Sgt James F. Daley and Deputy John R. Hogan
